customer_name: Twin Pine Farm and Exotics Conservation Foundation

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
An APHIS official arrived to the facility at approximately 11:17am. Upon arrival, the inspector was met at the gate by the
licensee’s husband, in which the inspector introduced themselves and stated they were here for a USDA inspection. The
licensee’s husband stated they would relay the message to the licensee who was in the home at the time. Upon his return
outside, he stated the facility would not be available for an inspection today due to the facility currently undergoing
renovations and construction. Records were also being sorted and reorganized.
The inspector explained that inspections could still take place, even if paperwork is not sorted and the facility is currently
undergoing construction. Further, the inspector explained to the facility that choosing not to conduct an inspection on
today would be considered a refusal. The licensee’s husband stated that both he and the licensee understood their
options, but wanted to elect the refusal due to the facility’s aforementioned concerns. To close out the inspection, the
inspector stated they would need to speak with the license to confirm they understood the extent of their request to refuse
an inspection on today, asking to confirm with the licensee if possible. Upon speaking with the licensee via phone, the
inspector recapped the discussion that took place with the licensee’s husband outside. When asked if they were refusing
an inspection on today, the licensee replied yes.
Animal welfare inspections conducted by APHIS officials are required to assess the wellbeing of the animals housed
therein and determine the facility’s compliance of the Animal Welfare Act and its regulations. Each dealer shall allow
APHIS officials to conduct inspections of the animals, facilities, and records during business hours.
Correct by February 21, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative and licensee.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)  Critical
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
An APHIS official arrived to the facility at approximately 11:17am. Upon arrival, the inspector was met at the gate by the 
licensee’s husband, in which the inspector introduced themselves and stated they were here for a USDA inspection. The 
licensee’s husband stated they would relay the message to the licensee who was in the home at the time. Upon his return 
outside, he stated the facility would not be available for an inspection today due to the facility currently undergoing 
renovations and construction. Records were also being sorted and reorganized. 
 
The inspector explained that inspections could still take place, even if paperwork is not sorted and the facility is currently 
undergoing construction. Further, the inspector explained to the facility that choosing not to conduct an inspection on 
today would be considered a refusal. The licensee’s husband stated that both he and the licensee understood their 
options, but wanted to elect the refusal due to the facility’s aforementioned concerns. To close out the inspection, the 
inspector stated they would need to speak with the license to confirm they understood the extent of their request to refuse 
an inspection on today, asking to confirm with the licensee if possible. Upon speaking with the licensee via phone, the 
inspector recapped the discussion that took place with the licensee’s husband outside. When asked if they were refusing 
an inspection on today, the licensee replied yes. 
 
Animal welfare inspections conducted by APHIS officials are required to assess the wellbeing of the animals housed 
therein and determine the facility’s compliance of the Animal Welfare Act and its regulations. Each dealer shall allow 
APHIS officials to conduct inspections of the animals, facilities, and records during business hours. 
 
Correct by February 21, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative and licensee. 
 
 n
